entry.title: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 2:32AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, Chesterfield, City of Richmond, Hanover and Henrico. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Hanover; Henrico

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 1:59AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Fog This Morning... Expect patchy fog this morning in the mountains and foothills of Virginia and North Carolina, including through the New River Valley and along I-77. Visibilities will change quickly over short distances and were less than one quarter mile in spots. Conditions will gradually improve later this morning.

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 23 at 9:39PM PDT until July 24 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINDY CONDITIONS WITH LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE COLUMBIA BASIN MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING... .On Monday, a robust weather system will push a cold front through the forecast area and make for more widespread windy conditions, particularly in the Cascade Gaps and Columbia Basin. Sustained winds around 20 to 25 mph are possible in the Basin
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Columbia Basin

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued July 23 at 1:49PM PDT until July 24 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...GUSTY WINDS AND DRY CONDITIONS MONDAY... .A cold front will approach Monday afternoon and sweep through Monday evening and night. Southwest winds will increase through the day becoming gusty Monday afternoon and evening with gusts of 25 to 35 mph. Temperatures Monday afternoon will climb into the upper 80s to low 90s with RH values in the teens to lower
entry.cap:areaDesc: Colville Reservation; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau; Western Columbia Basin

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 2:10AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL BAYFIELD AND WEST CENTRAL ASHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 245 AM CDT... At 210 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Iron River, or 39 miles east of Superior, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Ashland; Bayfield
